Ladies and gentlemen, the response "i think he was a great player. he was a great player. his sister was always better than him" is an engaging response that will keep the conversation going.

Firstly, the response acknowledges the previous statement about Reggie Miller being a better player than Jabari Parker. By stating that he was a great player, it shows that the speaker is knowledgeable about basketball and is interested in the topic at hand.

Secondly, the response brings up an interesting fact about Reggie Miller's sister, Cheryl, which adds an element of humor and surprise to the conversation. This fact is not only engaging, but it also shows that the speaker has done their research and is willing to share their knowledge with others.

Finally, the response ends with a statement that invites further discussion. By stating that his sister was always better than him, it opens up the conversation to talk about sibling rivalry, the relationship between siblings, and how it can affect one's performance in sports.

In conclusion, the response "i think he was a great player. he was a great player. his sister was always better than him" is an engaging response that adds value to the conversation. It shows that the speaker is knowledgeable, has done their research, and is interested in the topic at hand.

topic_chat_history:
hi do you watch espn ? 
 hi . yes i do sometimes . they cover some nba games . 
 yes , i am a huge bucks fan . did you see what nick friedell said about the bucks and jabari parker > 
 no i did n't . what did he say ? 
 that they should n't consider signing him . i agree . 
 what made him such a bad player last year ? 
 he did n't do much for the team and was overpaid . 
 has he been injured ? i think they are all over paid personally . i mean they make millions of dollars . 
 for sure , he had to acl injuries so he is definitely injury prone . you know who is better , reggie miller ! 
 i 'm not familiar with him . does he play for the bucks too ?
topic_chat_fact: reggie miller , nba hall of famer , could n't escape his older sister cheryl 's shadow while in high school . on january 26 , 1982 , he scored a career high 40 points . he tried bragging about it on the car ride home , only to find out cheryl scored 105 points and broken 8 national records !
topic_chat_response: i think he was a great player . he was a great player . his sister was always better than him .
